name: Zelos Cloud
headline: The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing
description:
Zelos Cloud is accelerating electronics product development with powerful tools for emulation, tracing, and automated testing on real microcontrollers in the cloud.

As firmware engineers, we spent years developing and shipping products at scale. Between batteries, bootloaders and brain implants, we've seen it all. Our mission is to build the tools we wish we had to enable teams to ship higher quality products, faster.

founders.name: Michael Jaradah, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder @ Zelos Cloud - The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing. 

Former Tesla Energy Firmware lead. Experienced across domains like embedded, networking, safety systems and validation infrastructure.

founders.name: Taylor Keairns, Founder
founders.description:
Co-Founder @ Zelos Cloud - The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing

Former Tesla Energy Firmware/Software lead. Specialized in system programming for embedded Linux and RTOS.

founders.name: John Ott, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder at Zelos Cloud - The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing.

Ex-Neuralink/Tesla full-stack engineer, with production deployed projects from bare-metal assembly to Kubernetes.

raw_markdown="[ ](https://zeloscloud.io/</>)
#  The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing 
### 
Single pane of glass for 
Firmware Manufacturing Test 
Contact us
![wave graphic](https://zeloscloud.io/_astro/hero-waves.Dor-id6V_Z13ymhS.png)
### Backed by
###  Powerful tools to accelerate product development 
####  Run on our hardware or yours 
#### Cloud-hosted Microcontrollers
Connect to cloud hosted Hardware-in-the-Loop. Real microcontrollers embedded in a custom I/O fabric enabling real-time emulation of connected hardware.
#### Tracing and Visualization
Observe full-system behavior with a suite of data capture and visualization tools. Fully integrated with cloud hardware, as well as many popular data acquisition systems.
#### Testing and Reports
Iterate quickly with a Python-based test framework with built-in support for common hardware, requirement tracking and reporting for standards compliant development.
### Meet the team
As firmware engineers, we spent years developing and shipping products at scale. Between batteries, bootloaders and brain implants, we've seen it all. Our mission is to build the tools we wish we had to enable teams to ship higher quality products, faster.
![Headshot of John Ott](https://zeloscloud.io/_astro/john.CM4CLmDd_2hF0pf.png)
#### John Ott
Former Neuralink software engineer. Full-stack engineer from bare-metal assembly to AWS-deployed Kubernetes.
![Headshot of Michael Jaradah](https://zeloscloud.io/_astro/michael.CN0jzCxe_YDARb.png)
#### Michael Jaradah
Former Tesla Energy firmware lead. Experienced across domains like embedded, networking, safety systems and validation infrastructure.
![Headshot of Taylor Keairns](https://zeloscloud.io/_astro/taylor.DmttN8Tc_Z1fwWt5.png)
#### Taylor Keairns
Former Tesla Energy firmware/software lead. Specialized in system programming for embedded Linux and RTOS.
Contact us

generated_description:
Zelos Cloud is making waves in the firmware development arena with a mission to be the first dedicated cloud platform for all things firmware. Founded in 2023 and hailing from Y Combinator's Batch S23, the company is fundamentally about speed and quality in electronics product development. Their tagline, "The First Cloud Platform for Firmware Development and Testing," succinctly encapsulates their ambition.

The team, although small—just three dedicated engineers—brings significant industry experience from leading companies like Neuralink and Tesla Energy. They aren't just theorists; they've battled the complexities of firmware development in real-world scenarios, from batteries to brain implants. Their shared experiences have shaped their goal: to build the exact tools they wished they had while shipping products. 

Zelos Cloud offers powerful tools for emulation, tracing, and automated testing, all facilitated through real microcontrollers in the cloud. This setup allows teams to connect seamlessly to cloud-hosted hardware, enabling real-time emulation of connected systems. Their offerings include a robust data capture and visualization suite, along with a Python-based test framework for quick iterations and compliance with development standards. It’s a single pane of glass for firmware manufacturing testing that promises to accelerate product development.

The founders embody a blend of skills and specialties, with backgrounds in full-stack engineering, embedded systems, and firmware validation. This diversity allows Zelos Cloud to cater to various aspects of the manufacturing cycle. 

If your firmware development needs a boost, Zelos Cloud might just be the partner you're looking for. Check them out at [zeloscloud.io](https://zeloscloud.io).
